chapter.title: Loading Profiles
chapter.para: From the profiles tab you can tell Glider to load a profile by specifying the path to the file. This requires you to know the exact path to the profile, however.

JGlideMon provides an easier solution for this. In the same folder as JGlideMon.jar is another file, Profiler.jar, that can be used to generate a file containing all of your profiles so that you don't need to memorize their paths.

You will need to launch Profiler.jar on the computer where you are running Glider. This implies that Java must also be installed on that computer before hand. You do not necessarily need to install JGlideMon itself on the computer running Glider, assuming you intend to run JGlideMon on a different computer. You only need to copy Profiler.jar by itself to the computer running Glider. Double-click it and you will be prompted to browse and select your Glider's exe file (whatever you named it).

Once you've selected Glider, profiles.dat will be generated in the same directory as Profiler.jar. You need to copy this file back to the computer where JGlideMon will be running into the folder containing JGlideMon.jar.

The profile list will appear on the "Profiles" tab the next time you start JGlideMon. If JGlideMon is already running, you can click the button to "Reload Profiles List from profiles.dat" on the "Profiles" tab.
